results.title: Belinda
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Jack Lee, Save the Children Fund and Trojan Films
results.brief_description: Chronicles the first few days of a three year old Aboriginal girl at a preschool kindergarten in Walgett, N.S.W. Shows the growth in trust between teacher and child until the girl and her mother disappear on walkabout.

results.title: Stand by me
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, Bruce A. Evans, Raynold Gideon, ACT III Communications and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.

results.title: Ngurunderi: a Ngarrindjeri Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Max Pepper, John Dick, Pepper Studios, S A Museum and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This Aboriginal myth, based on Albert Karloan’s version as told to Professor Berndt 1939-40, belongs to the Ngarrindjeri people of South Australia. It tells how Ngurunderi formed the landscape and the wildlife from the junction of the Murray Darling Rivers to Kangaroo Island where he left the world to become a bright star in the Milky Way. The Dreaming is re-enacted in the actual location it describes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Max Pepper, John Dick, Pepper Studios, S A Museum and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Blue Hawaii (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Hal Wallis Productions
results.brief_description: Chad Gates (Elvis Presley) returns to Hawaii after leaving the army. On his return he rebels against his rich and domineering mother (Angela Lansbury) and leaves the family pineapple business for a job as a tourist guide. Chad’s tours lead him straight into a tropical squall of trouble with his mother, the law and his girlfriend. Stars: Elvis Presley, Joan Blackman and Angela Lansbury.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Hal Wallis Productions

results.title: Mona Lisa
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Patrick Cassavetti, Stephen Woolley, HandMade Films and Palace Pictures
results.brief_description: Bob Hoskins plays a small-time con, just out of prison, who is delivering porn videos for a living. He gets a job as a minder to call-girl, Simone, (Cathy Tyson) and soon finds he is falling in love with her and assisting her to find her friend, Cathy, a young prostitute who has disappeared. A stylish film-noir set in contemporary London, “Mona Lisa” is also a challenging film about honour, responsibility and compassion in a society that is decaying and cruel. Cast also includes Michael Caine and Robbie Coltrane.

results.title: Paris is burning
results.brief_description: Paris is Burning is the result of the five years film-maker Jennie Livingston spent amongst New York City’s black and Hispanic transvestite community. Often poor and homeless the young gay men and drag queens form “houses” which conduct dances and balls dedicated to vogueing: the celebration of fashion, style and beauty. This is a fascinating documentary which confronts the viewer with a blurring of traditional notions of gender and sexuality and which also celebrates sexual, ethnic and racial diversity and difference. Features a great soundtrack of house and funk music. Winner of Best Documentary at the 1991 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Poison
results.creator_credit: Todd Haynes, Christine Vachon, Bronze Eye Prod and Zeitgesist Prod
results.brief_description: A film in three parts. In “Hero” a young boy kills his father who is abusing him and then the boy flies out of the window to Heaven. In “Horror” a possibly mad scientist finds he is falling victim to a disease created by his experiments in isolating the essence of the human sex drive. And in “Homo” a brutal prison love affair takes place in a Borstal prison that keeps changing shape and colour. Filmed in contrasting styles, initially seemingly random, the three episodes of “Poison” eventually come together to celebrate cinematic homoeroticism, the history of gay and queer subversion (especially the work of Jean Genet) and to delineate new possibilities for an erotic cinema. Beautifully made, ingeniously constructed and filmed “Poison” is part of a new form of cinema, a “queer cinema” that celebrates new forms of visual pleasure.

results.title: Cromwell
results.creator_credit: Ken Hughes, Irving Allen and Columbia
results.brief_description: The last flourish of the decadent Cavaliers, the obdurate zeal of the insurgent Puritans, the mighty clashes in Parliament and on the battlefields, the king’s death on the headsman’s block - a crucial phase of British history is encompassed in “Cromewell”. This powerful story unfolds majestically against a backdrop of pageant, bloody battle and the agonies of a country torn by civil war. Stars Alec Guinness as Charles I and Richard Harris as Oliver Cromwell with a distinguished supporting cast.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tourneur, Val Lewton and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: This classic horror tale stars Simone Simon as a young bride who is the victim of an ancient curse, that affects the female descendants of a Serbian village, transforming her into a panther to attack victims before reverting to human form. Also starring Kent Smith. Based on the story by DeWitt Bodeen.

results.title: Secret wedding
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Agresti, Allarts, Cinephile and Cogurccio
results.brief_description: Fermin (Tito Haas) is found in the streets of Buenos Aires, with no recollection of his past, 15 years after he had disappeared and was presumed dead. He returns to the village where he had left behind Tota (Mirtha Busnelli) the woman he promised to wed, but since his arrest by the Junta, she has become so absorbed in his memory that she doesn’t recognise him. As he attempts to resume his life, the conservative power structures in the town (the church and the military) find his presence threatening as they discover his true identity.
